Class Map

java.lang.Object
Map
public class Map extends Object

Representation of the game's map. A map is constructed from squares.

Version:
1.0.2 Last Changed: 9/12/24
Author:
Yuliia invalid input: '&' Spas.

  • Constructor Details

    • Map

      public Map(int newMapWidth, int newMapHeight)
      Create a new map with empty game objects.
      Parameters:
      newMapWidth - width of the map
      newMapHeight - height of the map

      entityLayer - entityLayer to assign

    • indexToGrid

      public GridPosition indexToGrid(int index)
      Returns a grid position from a passes list index. Determines x invalid input: '&' y coordinated based on the map's width. (Uses inverse Row major order index)
      Parameters:
      index - the list index.
      Returns:
      GridPosition coordinate at index

    • spawnGameObject

      public void spawnGameObject(GameObject gameObject)
      Spawns the provided GameObject according to its position and type. New tiles can only be spawned on Path tiles. New entities can only be spawned on Paths or in Water.
      Parameters:
      gameObject - object to spawn

    • destroyTile

      public void destroyTile(Tile tileToDestroy)
      Destroys the passed tile. Places a path on it's position
      Parameters:
      tileToDestroy - tile to be destroyed

    • destroyEntity

      public void destroyEntity(Entity entityToRemove)
      Removes the passed Entity from the Map.
      Parameters:
      entityToRemove - Entity to be removed

    • getPlayerObjectReference

      public Player getPlayerObjectReference()
      Returns a references to player object on the map.
      Returns:
      first instance of player object if one exists, null otherwise

    • getExitObjectReference

      public Exit getExitObjectReference()
      Returns:
      first instance of exit object if one exists, null otherwise

    • getNeighbourOf

      public GameObject getNeighbourOf(GameObject object, Direction direction)
      Returns the passed object's neighbour at the provided location, if one exists, null otherwise.
      Parameters:
      object - object to get neighbour of
      direction - direction relative to object to check
      Returns:
      the neighbouring game object, if one exists, null otherwise

    • getTileNeighbourOf

      public GameObject getTileNeighbourOf(GameObject object, Direction direction)
      Returns the passed object's neighbouring Tiles at the provided location, if one exists, null otherwise.
      Parameters:
      object - object to get neighbour of
      direction - direction relative to object to check
      Returns:
      the neighbouring Tile, if one exists, null otherwise

    • getEntityNeighbourOf

      public Entity getEntityNeighbourOf(GameObject object, Direction direction)
      Returns the passed object's neighbouring Entities at the provided location, if one exists, null otherwise.
      Parameters:
      object - object to get neighbour of
      direction - direction relative to object to check
      Returns:
      the neighbouring Entity, if one exists, null otherwise

    • setAmoebaProperties

      Parameters:
      growthRate - rate of growth
      growthLimit - limit of growth

    • gridToIndex

      public int gridToIndex(GridPosition mapCoordinate)
      Maps the index at the passed grid position to linear array index.
      Parameters:
      mapCoordinate - coordinate to return the index of
      Returns:
      an int representing array index based on the size of the map.
